intro: Senecio cacalioides, commonly known as the African Daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its bright yellow daisy-like flowers. The plant has narrow, linear leaves and can grow up to 30 centimeters tall. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Due to its ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens and landscapes.
